content.question_text: Commensalism is a type of relationship between two organisms in which one organism benefits while the other is unaffected. Which of the following is an example of commensalism?

options.A: Squirrels eat fruits and carry the seeds on their coat.
options.B: Venus fly trap plants consume insects for nitrogen.
options.C: Penicillium secretes penicillin, which kills bacteria.
options.D: Tree frogs use plants only for protection.

breakdown.step: Identify an interaction where one organism benefits and the other is unaffected

common_errors.misconception: Confusing commensalism with mutualism where both organisms benefit
common_errors.pedagogical_note: Seed dispersal benefits both squirrels and plants, so this is not commensalism

common_errors.misconception: Misidentifying predation as a symbiotic relationship
common_errors.pedagogical_note: Insect is harmed, so the relationship is predatory, not commensal
Killing or inhibiting another organism indicates harm, not neutrality

solution.expert_comment: Only option D shows one organism (tree frog) benefiting while the plant is neither helped nor harmed, which fits the definition of commensalism.
